verses.verse: Quietly remind them to be placing themselves under head rulers and authorities, to be loyal, to be ready toward every good action,
to be saying hurtful things about no one, to be non-arguers, polite, displaying all humility to all people.

You see, we ourselves in the past were also unobservant, unbelieving, being misled, being slaves to desires and various pleasures, leading through it in badness and envy, detesting, hating each other.
When the kindness and the benevolence of our Rescuer God was shined on us
(not from actions, the ones in the right way that we did, but in line with His forgiving kindness), He rescued us through a bath: a rebirth and renewal of the Sacred Spirit,
that He spilled out richly on us through Jesus, the Anointed King, our Rescuer,
so that when we were made right by that One's generosity, we might become inheritors in line with anticipation of life that spans all time.

The message is trustable. And concerning these things, I intend for you to be thoroughly authenticating them so that the people who have trusted in God may be made to focus to be presiding over nice actions. These are the nice and beneficial things for the people.
But stand clear of foolish questionings, genealogies, fightings, and law arguments. You see, they are nonbeneficial and futile.
Refuse a person of a sect after one and a second correction,
realizing that this type of person has been turned inside out and sins, being self-condemned.
When I will send Artemas to you or Tychicus, make every effort to come to me to Nicopolis. You see, I have decided to spend the storm season there.
Bring Zenas (the law expert) and Apollos aggressively on their way so that nothing may be missing to them.
Our people must also learn to be presiding over nice actions for the essential needs so that they may not be fruitless.

All the people with me say hello to you. Say hello to the people that we are fond of in trust. May the generosity be with you all. Amen. [Written to Titus (first elected supervisor of the assembly of Cretans) from Nicopolis, Macedonia]
